inn1.comm: angled across, that might have been called a wide later on in the innings but a sniff of leeway allowed there
tighter line, Tharanga back and drops at his feet
flicked off his pads behind square on the leg side, Broad has some ground to make up and that allows the second ... in any case, the throw is wayward
turned round the corner again, Broad zooms in and sends a wild throw to the bowler's end this time ... variety, spice of life etc
banged in - he really bent his back - and the ball slides over the ducking Jayasuriya
wide, Jayasuriya reaches, gets a thick bottom edge, the ball bangs into the turf behind the wicket and mustard leaps to his left to make a one-handed save as the ball heads high at first slip
Tharanga turned square, the ball squirts off a thick edge toward backward point
plays round his pad to midwicket
pushed to mid-on with soft hands, Jayasuriya was out of his crease like a whippet and even though the ball went straight to the fielder it was an easy run
driven to mid-off, too firmly for the single
turned into wide open spaces on the leg side, square leg has a lot of ground to make up to collect the ball out in the deep midwicket area
slower ball, back and defended
straight and full, defended
driven towards the off side but the ball gets a thick inside edge and squirms into the on side
driven to deep cover, Jayasuriya had to scurry back as Tharanga not interested in a second as Sidebottom fires in the low return
pushed a few yards towards midwicket, a quick run, Anderson scrambles to his left to field but he can't prevent the single
too far to leg, helped round the corner and it's fine enough to beat the fielder and that's the first boundary of the day
back of a length, outside off, no shot
full and straight, Jayasuriya back and blocks
slower ball beats a nothing prod, strikes the pad and a loud appeal from Sidebottom but it was heading down the leg side
whipped to leg for a single
down the leg, Mustard appeals for no other reasons that to try to distract Rudi Koertzen but the wise old owl is not taken in ....
wide and a sniff short, cut with some aggression but slap-bang to backward point
inside edge into pads, the ball dribbles into the off side and Jatasuriya shapes as if he wants the run but Sidebottom is there ina  trice and the batsman heads back to the crease
back, patted into the off side, extra cover roars in to prevent the single
outside off and a late decision to leave as the ball seams away from the left hander
short of a length, fended into the leg side but short midwicket in quickly
wider and a controlled cut to deep backward point
jumpy in the crease, inside edge into pads and out into the covers
cut past point but a fumble by backward point allows the run
slower ball, Tharanga waits and cracks that to the right of Pietersen at mid-off, not much power but enough to enable the single
a thick outside edge to third man
back of a length, defended
a rather limp drive, played down the wrong line and the ball beats the outside edge
outside off, again Tharanga misses as he shapes to cut ... a slightly low bounce did for him there
straight, Tharanga once more plays down the wrong line with not much foot movement, the ball finds a big gap between bat and pad and pins back the off stump
outside off, Sangakkara leaves
pulled up over square leg, enough to clear the ring fielders but to drop well short of the man in the deep
Sangakkara shimmies to leg, the ball thuds into his pads and dribbles behind square
a rather nothing pat into the covers
back into the crease and blocked
too short and Jayasuriya executes a textbook pull
looks to turn to leg but is beaten all ends up, a loud appeal for lbw but it pitched well outside leg
thick outside edge, all along the ground
neatly clipped to deepish midwicket
short, Jayasuriya steers the ball down to third man, just uses the pace of the ball to do the hard work
stands tall and punches the ball to mid-off, but off balance and so cannot get power into the stroke
plays off the back foot again, jabs the ball back to the bowler
immaculate forward defensive shot to an on-the-button delivery
snorter which rips past the outside edge ... Will Luke can hardly contain himself and unleashes a series of yelps
pushed into the off side for a sharp single ... that shouldn't have been a run though, the fielders ought to be a yard closer
flicked off his pads behind square, Broad has a long way to trundle round from long leg
driven to mid-off
slanted across Sangakkara who stands back and watches it pass
fuller but once more Sangakkara decides to leave
two steps and a heave but the ball barely gets to mid-on
short, Jayasuriya pulls but gets cramped and can't keep it down, Swann sprints in from deep backward square leg and slides into the catch, taking it a couple of inches above the turf
wide, a flash, a miss and Mustard fumbles as well, but first slip mops up
middle and off, defended to midwicket
right back onto his stumps, squirted to backward point
back and a controlled edge to third man
nudged off his hips. A poor ball on his legs, really
swinging down the leg side and Anderson is convinced he's got his man here, but it's comfortably drifting past the leg stump. Encouraging swing though for Anderson
well bowled. A testing line outside the off stump and Jayawardene shuffles back into his crease, angling this past the slips down to third man. Neatly played
close! Very, very close indeed. More bounce for Anderson, forcing the left-hander back into his crease and he blocked it off the back foot, the ball evading his leg stump by a cat's whisker
cautiously, warily prodded off the back foot. A good line outside off stump here
ooh and this one keeps low, scudding along the turf to Mustard
just short of a length, Jayawardene is solid in defence off the back foot
fuller this time and it's firmly pushed out to cover
forced out to cover off the back foot
good line again, defended off the back foot
a false shot from Jayawardene. On his off stump and swinging back into him, he gets a thick inside edge - thick enough to grab a single
nudged to leg but he can't find the gap

got him! Terrible shot from Jayawardene. A loosener from Broad, dropping it short and wide but Jayawardene flayed his bat at it without keeping it down, the ball flying straight to Paul Collingwood at point who took it comfortably at face height
too straight and worked off his toes for an easy single to get off the mark
short of a length, Sangakkara rocks back and defends
very well bowled, Broad. Full and straight, cutting back into Sangakkara who plays it well in the end, knocking it to leg off his toes. Ball kept disconcertingly low, though
the wrong length this time, much too short and Sangakkara can whip it through square leg with ease
good end to a successful first over for Broad as Sangakkara is forced to defend his off stump off the back foot
lovely delivery, forcing the right-hander back into his stumps and he defends it cautiously
quicker but wide, Silva's eyes light up and he tries to cut this but it keeps a little low. A play-and-miss
ooh close once again. Wonderful ball, cutting away from the right-hander who prods and misses
on middle-and-leg, swinging back into his legs and it's nudged off the back foot
a touch straighter this time. Silva defends
pushed back to the bowler who collapses to the ground to field

and he's walked! How extraordinary. Wide of the off stump, Sangakkara cut and missed, the ball flying through to Mustard who didn't appeal. And nor did Broad...but Sangakkara tucked his bat under his arm and marched off. A poor piece of cricket. It was the thinnest of edges, and no England player appealed, yet Sangakkara marched off to cause confused (albeit delighted) expressions from England's fielders
ooh close once again, a play-and-miss outside the off stump
a good start, forcing him back into his crease but a neat nudge to leg yields a single
close! Silva came forward tentatively, and got a thin nick on it - but the ball fell short of Mustard
well bowled Broad. Tentatively poked out to cover by Silva
Silva tries to drive this straight down the ground but it squirts out to cover. Good start by Broad
just short of a length, it's firmly and solidly defended off the back foot
"catch" is the rather desperate attempt by Sidebottom to distract the umpire, but he stretches out his arm to this leg-side drifter to signal a wide
a short-arm pull, swivelling this through midwicket for a couple
fabulous ball! Really well bowled indeed, cutting this across the right-hander who was expecting it to come back into him
close! Very close indeed as he's rapped on the pads to this straight delivery...but it's going over the top (but only just)
marvellous shot that, picking it up off his legs and lofting it over midwicket for four
Sidebottom roars an appeal for lbw but he's got bat on that. But, oh dear, Cook's throw is wild and wooly and it goes for four overthrows
nudged off his hip. A leg-side stray
smacked off the back foot but straight to point
that's a top shot. It wasn't even that short, but Dilshan pounced on it and pulled it powerfully in front of square for four
wide of the off stump and ignored
excellent ball. Swinging into the batsman who defends
he nearly dabs at this outside the off stump before rightly ignoring it
rubbish ball, wide of the off stump and it's guided down to a vacant third man. Someone, I can't see who, runs around from deep point to field
short, wide and cut with power out to backward point
nudged off his legs
much better delivery, swinging in and attacking his off stump. Defended very solidly on the front foot
and another good nut, in the corridor of uncertainty (© Boycs). Firmly blocked out
whipped off his toes
good line, defensively punched off the back foot to cover
this cramps him for room and he steps to leg, cutting it out to deep cover point
cracked off the back foot to point
a filthy wide, winging its wily wide ways wide of the off stump
firmly blocked out on the front foot
guided to point
flayed to point on the front foot for another zero
good start. A little wobbler swinging into the right hander who gets a thick inside edge
slightly quicker and left alone outside the off stump
fuller this time and it's elegantly driven, opening the face of the bat, out to deep point
nudged out to point. Again...
very close! A little wibbly wobbler outside the off stump. Silva tries to dab it but is beaten by the complete lack of pace
punched to cover
a leg-stump full toss which he doesn't really connect with as well he might. Sidebottom makes a mess of it at fine-leg
confidently driven to mid-off
on leg stump, he nudges it to leg
a good, quick bouncer from Broad and it hurries the batsman who tries to hook but can't connect
pulled around the corner
pushed back to the bowler
too wide, comfortably cut. Runs coming easily here
carefully defended on the front foot. A good line, this, from Collingwood
whipped off his legs. Broad's throw is accurate, and Mustard's bail-whipping enthusiastic, but they're comfortably home for two
flicked off his pads
driven on the up out to the sweeper on the boundary
much too short and pulled away with ease. Broad does well to prevent four, but it's another couple of runs for this pair
encouraging turn for Swann here, the ball rebounding off the right-hander's arm, I think, just evading slip
paddled around the corner
firmly blocked out. Good line from Swann, bowling it flat and fast

what a stroke of fortune for Swann, and a neat piece of keeping from Mustard. Silva tried to sweep from outside the off stump, got a bottom edge onto his boot which flew to Mustard's right who stuck out his right paw to take a slick catch
fired into his legs, it's helped around the corner
flicked to short midwicket
full but too straight and it's easily knocked around the corner. Square leg is too deep, and the single is easily stolen
and that's well bowled, testing the left-hander's off stump. Firmly blocked out
again, a good, tight ball on off stump which is defended solidly
three in a row, and the straightest of each
a smidgen wider. He's forward and blocking, once again
a little offie to finish the over to which Dilshan plays and misses. In fact, he might well have edged it but Mustard's not (yet) standing up to the stumps
an attempted sweep but he can't connect
ooh what a catch that would've been! Driven back aerially to Swann's left who dived to his left and nearly pulled off a stunning one-handed catch
the first six of the match as Mubarak smacks Swann cleanly over long-off
pushed out to cover

got him this time! Tossed up by Swann to invite him down the pitch, Mubarak is beaten by the lack of pace and succeeds only in chipping it straight back to the bowler. A soft wicket, but a very clever piece of bowling
a leg-side drifter flicked for a single
excellent line, swinging into the right hander who cautiously defends
a bouncer! Wided by the umpire, rightly so. It was hammered into the pitch a metre or so by the non-striker, and it had to be to get it over the batsman's head
nudged out to midwicket for an easily run single
sliced past backward point. Fine leg sprints round to prevent four
the slower ball but he reads it, nudges it and runs for a single. Anderson has an excellent arm and hits the stumps, but he's safely home
pushed back to the bowler
a slower ball cracked out to deep point for a single
full, straight - in fact a full toss, pumped through midwicket
pushed out to cover. Pietersen dives to save
full, straight and defended to leg
drops this down out to the off side and they run a quick single
left alone outside off
defended on the front foot
dropped by Shah at first slip. Excellent ball from Broad inducing a weak drive which takes a thick outside edge and Shah can't quite get down to it.
pushed back to Broad who fields in his follow-through and shies at the stumps with a powerful wing
good bowling, this. Full and straight, the batsman shuffles across to the off side to defend
outside edge again, and again it flies through Shah's buttery fingers at first slip
swinging into his legs, it's plucked through midwicket for a single. Pietersen swoops, misses and blasphemes
flicked through midwicket
another excellent return catch from Swann. Tossed up and Maharoof simply chipped it straight back to Swann who took it an inch or two from the ground
punched back to the bowler
"aww," cries Mustard as he pushes this back to the bowler
punched, aerially, out to cover
pushed back to the bowler
neatly defended
steered into the off side
very wide and full, Dilshan leans back and creams that through the covers, a super shot and the pull purred across the damp outfield
wide and short, cut into the grass and wide of backward point, the man in the deep on the 45 fields
short, an attempted pull doesn't come off and a thick bottom edge crunches into his pads
fuller, swings across the left hander and no shot
a poke and a miss outside off stump, Mustard takes by his feet
premeditated paddle sweep, to far outside off and the ball goes nowhere
attempted paddle, missed and taken on the pads
jerky, jagged poke behind square on the off
a step, a stop, and then a front-foot jab into a gap on the off side
steps back and plays the ball some way from him, opens the face and steers the ball wide of slip and the pace of a quicker delivery did the rest
a stride and a clip but slap-bang to midwicket
feels for the ball with little footwork, it comes off an angled face to third man
half forward, cut and superbly stopped at backward point by a tumbling and utterly reliable Collingwood
again hit on the walk with an open face, but Collingwood is there once more
checked defensive prod, short extra cover does the necessary
wide and short, larruped with real power square but guess who stops again
short, it sits up and Dilshan pulls but with no timing, the ball dribbles two thirds of the way to the man in the deep

back, waits and cuts the ball oh-so-late ... Dilshan comes back for the second, taking on Bopara's throw from deep point, but the return is fired in at the bowler's end, right to the top of the stumps on the bounce, Swann removes the bails with Vaas short despite a full-length dive
plopped into the leg side
turned square on the off side, this time Bopara has too much ground to make up and there is an easy second
swept off middle-and-off stump
driven up to long-off
stretching forward poke squirts to backward point
savage cut to Collingwood at backward point and, almost needless to say, he makes a theatrical and excellent stop
another herat-and-soul stroke, a pull this time, but not timed and a thick edge goes into the ground and then sits at his feet
angled - well, he was actually taking the bat away at the last second - and the ball flies to the right of a diving Mustard ...not a chance
slightly shorter and Dilshan misses with a cut
speared down the leg side, it clips Dilshan's pads as he shapes to glance, and the ball evades Mustard's dive and zooms to the rope
again fired it at the batsman's legs, this time he clips it into the deep
clipped very late to midwicket
steered with an open face to deep cover to reach a battling fifty
solid forward push through cover
floated outside off ... Fernando  tempted and he misses with a bit of a prod
worked with a little luck into the leg side
firm straight drive, Swann drops to his right and half stops, enough to prevent the run
dobbler outside off, it almost hangs in the air and Fernando jabs and misses
outside off, too much so for Koertzen who signals the wide
jerky prod into the covers
Fernando starts to come forward and is caught on the hop by a sniff of extra bounce and has to settle for a defensive dead bat
driven with a thick outside edge, that helps the ball find a gap on the off side
slower, Fernando waits and pushes to midwicket
slower, Fernando waits and pushes to midwicket
beaten outside off as he tries to run the ball down to third man
flighted,a  lunge and a miss once again
slightly fuller and a rather ugly drive across the line up to long-on
using his feet well, meets the ball on the half volley and clips to deep midwicket
once more Fernando plays across the line to long-on, effective but not one to show your children
well played, wristily turned to a space at midwicket
back, midwicket round to field
firm drive to cover, Bell claws the ball just as it seemed to have got past him but still not able to prevent the single
short, paddled with a tennis-like dab to third man
leg-stump-line, played behind square on the leg side and quick running enables a well-run two
prodigious inswing, helped into the leg side
very wide and full - would have been called had he left it - driven and Shah sprints round from deep cover to gather and return five yards in from the boundary
edgily pokes into the cover, Pietersen can't cut off the run and he loops a sky-high return to Swann
one step and he crashes all along the ground through extra cover, once it beat the man there it was four all the way
worked to midwicket
driven to long-on, falling over as he does so but he keeps the ball down
arm ball, Fernando prods and looks bewildered as the ball beats him
prodded off the open face to Pietersen at backward point
turned to midwicket. "Nice, Colly" shouts Mustard.
inside edge scurries into the leg side and a walked single
a filthy swing, a thick edge and the ball zips down to third man
full toss, flat batted with no follow through over mid-off .. all rather surreal
fired down the leg side, a really good take by the keeper but it's still a wide
rasping drive through cover, Shah makes a despairing dive racing round from deep cover but the ball was always ahead of him
punched off the back foot to deep extra cover, and he gets the single to keep the strike
and he has his fourth wicket, Dilshan caught in two minds, and he scoops a half volley gently  to Collingwood at midwicket
defended watchfully, pushed through on off stump
sweeps from outside off, misses and the ball hits him on the pad
tossed right up, invitingly, Malinga doesn't bite and defends
squirted out of the blockhole to short third man
pushed up, defended
yup ... Fernando swings at a shortish ball, had he middled it, it would have headed over midwicket ... he didn't and it looped softly off a top edge to Collingwood at point

inn2.comm: some encouraging wobble for Vaas straight away. No great pace, but a good line and length forcing Cook forward to defend
straighter this time and Cook is watchful in defence
swinging away from the left-hander who warily pokes at it outside off
oh but this one cuts back into Cook who plays it late, expecting it to straighten. It's blocked out safely enough
defended solidly enough off the back foot, but again Cook is back in his crease and waiting to gauge the swing
and it's guided out to mid-off to end a predictably accurate and economical first over
a wild delivery outside off to which Mustard tries to cart into the Indian Ocean. And misses
better ball this time, cutting back into Mustard who jabs down on it at the very last moment
another wide, though for some reason not called wide this time even though it was wider than the first wide
and another swing-and-a-miss from Mustard. Better, tighter delivery this time from Maharoof, who's not yet on fire but has found a good length
hammered through the covers for four. It was a half-volley, truth be told, but he leant into it and creamed it with pleasant timing
what a ball! A little offie (or a left-hander's leggie) cutting away from him at the last moment
and another play-and-miss

excellent ball, drawing Cook into a defensive poke but he never moved his feet. A full delivery outside his off-stump, it cut away at the last moment and the keeper took a comfortable catch to his left
and here's Bell, immediately walking down the pitch to defend
a massive appeal by Vaas who showed an impressive pair of tonsils there, not to mention decibel levels, but it was missing Bell's leg stump by several large inches
good length on off stump, hurrying Bell a touch who inside-edges it
well he's timed the pants off that one, a gorgeous Mike Athertonesque flick off his hips through square leg for four. Beautifully placed.
good end to the over swinging this into the right-hander who blocks it out with fervour
short of a length and well wide of his off stump, Mustard simply smacks it on the up over the infield. Powerfully struck
much better delivery this time. Fuller and straighter, cutting away from Mustard's inauspicious poke
good grief. Mustard dances down the pitch like Mark Ramprakash after too many coffees, and almost wraps his bat around his head in a vain attempt to hit him out of the ground
and he gets off strike with a calm push for one out to cover
Bell advances down the pitch before presenting the straightest of straight bats
good line just outside the off stump, blocked out solidly
chipped to short extra cover
very well bowled indeed attacking the off stump. Firmly defended
wider this time, Mustard's eyes light up and he tries to carve Vaas into the covers but misses
a delicious shot from Mustard smacking this straight back past Vaas for four. Beautifully struck
poor ball on his legs and Mustard chips him to short midwicket for an impish single
Bell is back, across and defending
down the leg side and wided
pushed just past the very short midwicket but no chance of a single there
beautifully bowled. A nagging length and Mustard was caught in two minds, eventually trying to poke at it outside off
bowled him! Unlucky for Mustard who tried to pull but it wasn't quite short enough, and the ball rattled off his legs and bobbled onto his leg-stump
Pietersen is forward and defending solidly
left alone outside off
picked from outside off to midwicket, but he can't find the gap
very well timed, just a punch off his hip through midwicket but it raced along
Pietersen looks to climb into this but can't time it, and he gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
picked off his leg stump down to fine leg. Neatly and crisply struck but straight to the fielder
as ever, Bell is confidently down the pitch before angling this past point. Third man runs round to field
a fine looking defensive stroke from Pietersen, clamping down on this off-side delivery and punching it back to the bowler with the straightest of bats
very well timed and hit as straight as an arrow...but Vaas fields in his follow-through
what a stroke. He appeared to be beaten for pace, and was certainly hurried into this pull stroke but somehow timed it brilliantly and it shot for four past square leg. What timing
firmly defended on the front foot
a slower ball pumped to mid-off
well bowled, cutting this into Bell who is cautiously defending off the back foot - head right over the ball
punched to nowhere
but that's beautifully played, down the pitch and creaming this through the covers for four
nudged to mid-on and Bell calls through Pietersen for a cheeky single
pushed out to cover
punched off the back foot to cover
a quicker one, accompanied by a huge Monica Seles roar, which means nothing because it's miles too wide
pushed back to the grunting Fernando
beautifully punched off the toe of the bat, but straight to cover
magnificently played by Bell, leaning forward onto the front foot before rocking back quickly to punch this off the back foot, square of the wicket
and he's done it again but without the timing of the previous stroke
gone! That's the big one and he can't believe it. Swinging into Pietersen who played all around it, trying to whip it to leg, and it would've taken out his off stump
Collingwood dances down the pitch ala Bell before leaving it outside off
Collingwood steps across his stumps before defending. The bowler roars the most hopeful of appeals but Collingwood got plenty of bat on that
left alone outside off
a slower leg-cutter which takes Collingwood by surprise who, at the very last moment, late-cuts it past the lone slip who's desperate dive parries it to a short third man
squirted to third man
poor stroke, it really was a hopeless waft there from Collingwood. It's wobbling about all over the place at the moment - through the air and off the pitch
but Collingwood is right behind this one, solidly defending it off the back foot
punched out to extra cover
solidly blocked out off the back foot
fuller and straight, drawing him forward to defend...which he does
flicked to midwicket for a zero

catch! A wonderful catch by Dilshan at backward point. Bell climbed into this shorter delivery and appeared to nail it off the back foot, cutting it with a crack of the bat but Dilshan dived to his right and grasped a very fine catch.
short and quick, Shah drops his hands and leaves it alone
a beautiful punchy drive from Shah with a high front elbow, and he's timed it nicely but cover dives on top of it
turned off middle-stump down to fine-leg
good length but it's still wide enough to be ignored
down the leg side, Collingwood chips it to leg for a single
cautiously forward to this fuller ball on off stump which is defended solidly
an ugly punch off the back foot. Only Collingwood can make that stroke look so awkward and unnatural, but it was effective enough (as ever)
the teaser: a slower ball outside off, nice and full and Collingwood is drawn into an expansive drive. He misses, and Sangakkara also fumbles behind the stumps allowing them through for a single
Shah hides his bat inside his pad here. No need to play at that
left alone again. Much too wide
what a stroke that is. A full toss, very wide of off, and he simply laid a bat on it and it absolutely flew, all along the ground, past point for four. Extraordinary stroke
punched back to the bowler who threatens to kill the batsman with a shy at the stumps. Collingwood runs out of the way
too straight and he flicks it off his pads to fine-leg
too wide and it's left alone. No need to bother with those
elegantly placed out to cover but they'll need to get a move on here...and Shah does, and they get home
firmly blocked out
excellent fielding from short extra cover prevents this majestic drive from yielding anything other than a big, fat, round zero
firmly punched but, yet again, he can't break the infield
ooh, he picked this one off his toes at the very last moment
left alone outside off
left alone once more
dropped. Well bowled, beating Collingwood all ends up. He came forward and appeared to get a thin inside edge to the keeper who spilled a difficult chance to his right
solidly defended
a nagging line outside off to which Shah presents the straightest of defensive blades
a vast appeal by every Sri Lankan in a two mile radius to one which Shah poked at, but there didn't appear to be an edge on that. I think it was just a rather good delivery. Maharoof's on fire
guided to point
neatly nudged to leg
onto the front foot and pushed out to cover for a single
dully defended to cover, again
swinging into the right-hander who defends
Shah roars "yes" the moment he hits this down to fine-leg. Excellent running
nudged to midwicket
defended, again
chopped to mid-off
sliced to point
pushed off his hip
late cut to third man
smacked to mid-off with absolutely no timing
on off stump, it's blocked out
he plays and misses outside off
Collingwood's got himself into a right royal muddle here as he tries to defend this one off the back foot but is rapped on the thigh
fast and straight, almost squaring up the batsman but it bobbles out meekly to the off side
pushed to leg
defended square of the wicket
guided out to point
nurdled to leg
swinging into the leg stump of Shah who is knocked off his feet. Malinga appeals out of shock more than anything else
four! Four runs to Collingwood! Drama abound here as Collingwood latches onto a loosener from Mahroof, cutting this and timing it very nicely indeed. Well done that man
Collingwood's on a roll here, knocking this off his legs for a single
crunched to mid-off
guided straight to point
defended by the increasingly hirsute Shah
whacked to cover
worked round the corner of his hips
Shah back and blocks ... as Malinga picks it up in his follow through Hsha nods to acknowledge a decent delivery
back and drives but not timed
a fast bouncer which Shah ducks ... good thinking young man
fast and straight, Shah into line
wide and a little short, cut hard on the bounce to point
sweetly clipped off his pads to deep square leg
pushed firmly off the back foot to long-on
rips past the defensive lunge, hits the pads and Dilshan races down the pitch yelping a prolonged and actually painful-sounding appeal ... but it hit Collingwood well outside the line for starters
steps back and clips it to midwicket
hit on the half volley - with a one-legged flourish - to midwicket
full and driven on the bounce back to the bowler
defensive prod into the leg side
turned from on off stump past midwicket, Shah takes on the man coming in from the boundary and makes his ground at the non-striker's end with a dive ... Malinga drops a decent return anyhow
cut to backward point and unison cries of "no" from both ends
almost in the blockhole, Collingwood digs it out and then blinks repeatedly as if to indicate he didn't pick that up until late
worked into the leg side
driven straight on the leg side, Jayasuriya dives to his left at mid-on and gets a hand on it but actually seems to add to the speed of the ball and it beats the chasing pack to the rope
mistimed drive into the covers
worked with the spin to short fine leg
he waits and then punches the ball very late through midwicket
turned to square leg but there's a man there for just that touch
a wristy backfoot flick through midwicket from outside of stump
a wristy backfoot flick through midwicket from outside of stump

two steps and driven hard back at Dilshan who gets a hand to the ball but can't stop it. Mid-on has to chase as Shah sprints the first and that enables him to come back for the second with some comfort
slower ball to start - and a too short - Shah picks it and punches into the off side
another slower one, Collingwood runs it to third man off a thick edge
Shah back and cracks the ball to extra cover ... he holds the pose for the photographers
defended with soft hands, Collingwood up for the single but Shah wisely sends him back
Shah has to reach to get on top of a wide delivery, he does so and Malinga has a lot of ground to make up hurtling round from third man, Shah back quickly for the second
back and chopped into the covers
full, good length, blocked
overpitched, turned to backward square leg
a bit short but the ball scoots through and Shah ends up cramped and has to block
correct and upright defensive
down the leg side, turned behind square where the substitute makes a complete pig's ear of a simple stop
driven gently to long-off
slowest of slow balls, Collingwood fooled and the ball finally reaches Sangakkara on the third bounce and thumps him on the leg
driven with the inswing to mid-on
outside off, Collingwood shapes to run the ball to third man but misses
half forward and dead batted into the covers
slingy action and he pulls the ball wide of the off stump ... but not wide enough to rouse Koertzen from his evening nap
driven through the off side - his bottom hand came off the bat as he played it
angled in, defended
Shah's patience snaps, he gives Jayasuriya the change, misses, and the ball hits the top of his leg stump. He was so far down that he would have been stumped anyhow even if the ball had missed
back, punches a leg-side delivery into space at midwicket
pushed back to the bowler
watchful defence
down the leg side, Collingwood misses out as the ball thumps into his pads
swinging in, Bopara hunched over the bat as he defends

a rather uncertain poke into the on side, Collingwood turns for the second, is rightly sent back, he slips and has to lunge for his crease ... had the throw been half decent he might have been in trouble
full and wide, no shot
loud shout as misses an attempted flick to leg ... always heading down the leg side and Kortzen not remotely interested ... he doesn't even bother to shake his head
bat and pad jammed together in a solid defensive poke
angled down to third man
Collingwood digs that out ... it was shooter and he was back
forward, a thick edge into the on side
a big stride forward to block
back, he waits and thumps it to long-on
good line and length, no choice but to defend
turned into the on side, a thought from both ends of a run but a quick reassessment as midwicket roars in
too full, firmly driven to deep cover, Collingwood content to amble the single
a thick outside edge to third man
again full, driven square into the covers
back of a length, Bopara back, stands tall and defends
very wide, Bopara launches into a drive but gets it low on the bat and so there's no power in the shot
plopped to midwicket
what was in that drink?!  Collingwood pushes forward to defend, the ball goes on with arm past the bat, and Asoka De Silva has his hand up in a flash
rips past the outside edge as Swann caught neither back nor forward
Swann back and defends
clipped through midwicket
a stride and he almost yorks himself, chops down just in time
off-balance drive to extra cover
a rasping appeal as Swann misses a flick to leg, but a good call from Koertzen as there was a thick inside edge on that
steered to the left of backward point
flicked from off stump through midwicket, another misfield in the deep from the hapless substitute allows a third when there should only have been two
Swann stands tall and punches that off the back foot to deep cover
slower one right up in the blockhole, the speed did for Bopara and the ball hit right in front as he shaped to clip to leg. Kenny Rogers has no doubt and up goes the finger.
Broad defends ... the pressure is on now
full, driven softly into the off side and Jayasuriya fields
Swann waits and turns to midwicket
two steps and a defensive push ... he misses and takes it on the pad
a big swing to leg, he misses and again takes it on the front pad
turned to the right of midwicket, he makes a good sliding stop and fires in the return in one smooth movement
a couple of steps and he lofts that over mid-on to the audible anguish of several fielders ...
Broad steps across his stumps, turns it  to leg, Malinga sprints to field, gets there and then misses the ball
well-timed push through cover off the back foot
Broad right back - almost steps on his stumps he takes such a big step - and defends
very wide down the leg, Broad wafts and Sangakkara gathers
turned late off his hips to deep midwicket where there is a wide open space
too much width, cut to deep point
slower ball,  Swann foxed and plays a one-handed dab to point
forward and flicked to leg, well placed
Swann steps to leg, Jayasuriya half follows and the ball ends up with extra cover
patted back to the bowler
another shimmy to leg and patted to deep cover
Broad forward, a thick inside edge squirts into the leg side
Swann shapes to hit straight but the ball loops up and over extra cover and he can't turn and get there
very wide, a big slash and a thick edge flies on three or four bounces to the third-man boundary. No chance as there are no slips ... but that doesn't stop much muttering from the bowler
good response, straight and full, well defended
Swann again can do no more than block
Malinga again gives too much width, Swann leans back and slaps that behind square on the off side
half forward and defends
full, driven firmly back to Malinga who clings onto the ball on the half volley
wide outside off, Broad, who favours the leg side, not tempted
again on an outside-off line, blocked
very wide, again Broad lets it go
straighter one but Broad into line
outside off but this time he choses to go forward and defend
clipped to midwicket
driven through the off side for a single
back and across, patted into the off side
Broad steps to the off, is hit on the pad as he does so and there's a rather ambitious - ie frivolous - appeal as the ball pitched well outside leg
turned from off stump into the leg side, they races back for the second and Broad was home with something to spare
authentic drive to point
another loud appeal which Koertzen shakes his head to ... you could see three stumps as it speared down the leg but Fernando still barked one out
paddled into the leg side
Broad blocks
down the leg, a wide, Sangakkara appealed and then underarmed at the bowler's end and had he hit Swann was off ...
driven into the leg side
tip and run into the covers
angled very wide across Broad who cuts but misses
mistimed drive to extra cover
outside the off stump, he guides this down to third man
a classy looking punch out to a deep point
full, straight, Swann smacks it but it hits the bottom of his bat and the ball bobbles meekly to mid-off. Absolutely no timing
swinging down the leg side and the bowler roars a yelped appeal, but it really is miles down leg

ooh and he plays and misses outside off! Very close indeed there. He came lumbering forward, Broad, without conviction and poked at it like an old man gesturing with his walking stick at some unruly asbo kids
punched back to the bowler
swept calmly to square leg
Broad's right behind this slower ball, blocking it with his lumbering frame cowering over the ball
pushed out to cover defensively
chipped to the bowler's left who makes a good diving stop
chipped to Vaas at mid-on who, somehow, lets the ball slip through. Dreadful (and hilarious) piece of fielding and they come back for two
Broad rocks back and cuts this late for a single. He retains the strike
and a vast appeal by the bowler but that's sliding down the leg side by about a metre
full, straight and defended. A no-ball - and Swann has a free hit
chipped over the top of mid-on just for a couple
he's bowled him! Goodnight Graeme. Full, straight and swinging back into Swann who tried to lift him over midwicket and was clean bowled
and he plays and misses outside off. Extra bounce and bite in that delivery
fast but misdirected on Sidebottom's legs. A careful nudge gives him a single and he retains the strike
flicked off his pads - again, another leg-side drifter
flatter delivery on off stump. Sidebottom blocks it out ala A. Border
excellent stroke, a free-flowing drive out into the off side for three. Rubbish delivery from Jayasuriya: much too full and wide
not that important. Not yet, anyway, as Broad clamps down on this like a traffic warden
and that's punched to mid-off, Broad wants a single but Sidebottom rightly turns it down
nudged to leg for a zero
well flighted by Jayasuriya; solidly defended by Broad
a single out to cover -  excellent running, and not very intelligent fielding. Sri Lanka's infield were on their heels there
well bowled! A quick ball spearing into Broad's pads, and Broad is right back into his crease and defending it with his life
a full toss on his pads which Broad calmly whips to leg without fuss
another poor ball down the leg-side - a misdirected slower ball which wobbles off Sidebottom's legs, or possibly bat, and Broad is alive to the opportunity of another run
and he's rapped on the pads, but it's much too high. And the angle too extreme
a massive wide which Broad could've easily left, but instead he reached out for it and got a chippy edge down to third man
flighted on off stump but Broad is patient, calm and solid in defence
shorter this time and Broad cracks it into the off side off the back foot, but straight to the fielder
fuller and straighter, Broad chips it back to the bowler who fields well to save the single
cracked off the back foot - a good shot and they do get the single this time
well bowled. Fired into Sidebottom who clamps down on it
guided out to point and they run an easy single
close! So close there. A vicious, swinging ball which evades the off stump...and evades Sidebottom's bat too
another zippy delivery but it's wild and misdirected down the leg side. Sidebottom gets bat on it and they scamper a single
full, fast and straight - not quite yorker length, but nasty enough. Broad's up to the challenge, however, jabbing down on it at the last moment
full, swinging into Broad - Malinga's desperate to find this yorker but it's not quite working. Broad leans into it and plays a beautiful extra cover drive for four
flicked off his pads, just evading the short midwicket and there's the match for England. A great effort from Broad
